Cleanup existing polling interval when the component is destroyed.

trailingComments.value: Define a closure to schedule a poll.

leadingComments.value: FIXME: In unit test mode, we need to do the next polling synchronously. For some reason, nested
async functions are not waited for. In this case, we simply inspect the callback return value
in order to fake the promise resolution.

trailingComments.value: Normalize the callback as a promise. Schedule the next poll, only if it resolves.

leadingComments.value: Normalize the callback as a promise. Schedule the next poll, only if it resolves.
Define a closure to schedule a poll.

*
         * @param {Function} asyncCallback An asynchronous function to be executed in defined interval. This function
         *   should return a promise, which when resolved will result in the next poll being scheduled. If the promise
         *   is rejected, the polling will stop.
         * @param {Integer} interval Time in milliseconds between the executions.
         * @param {Boolean} randomize Whether to randomize the interval (±1000 milliseconds). Useful to prevent
         * congestions.
         * @description
         *   Sets up the polling interval which will execute supplied asynchronous callback function in the defined
         *   interval. Note that this method is designed for asynchronous callbacks, and to this end you should always
         *   aim to return a promise in the callback function. In case the polling is already set up, the method will
         *   not do anything.

*
         * @name clearPollingInterval
         * @description
         *   Clears up the polling interval. In case the polling wasn't already set up, the method will not do anything.

Cleanup existing polling interval when the component is destroyed.

*
         * @param {Function} asyncCallback An asynchronous function to be executed in defined interval. This function
         *   should return a promise, which when resolved will result in the next poll being scheduled. If the promise
         *   is rejected, the polling will stop.
         * @param {Integer} interval Time in milliseconds between the executions.
         * @param {Boolean} randomize Whether to randomize the interval (±1000 milliseconds). Useful to prevent
         * congestions.
         * @description
         *   Sets up the polling interval which will execute supplied asynchronous callback function in the defined
         *   interval. Note that this method is designed for asynchronous callbacks, and to this end you should always
         *   aim to return a promise in the callback function. In case the polling is already set up, the method will
         *   not do anything.
Define a closure to schedule a poll.
FIXME: In unit test mode, we need to do the next polling synchronously. For some reason, nested
async functions are not waited for. In this case, we simply inspect the callback return value
in order to fake the promise resolution.
Normalize the callback as a promise. Schedule the next poll, only if it resolves.

*
         * @name clearPollingInterval
         * @description
         *   Clears up the polling interval. In case the polling wasn't already set up, the method will not do anything.

Define a closure to schedule a poll.
FIXME: In unit test mode, we need to do the next polling synchronously. For some reason, nested
async functions are not waited for. In this case, we simply inspect the callback return value
in order to fake the promise resolution.
Normalize the callback as a promise. Schedule the next poll, only if it resolves.

*
         * @name clearPollingInterval
         * @description
         *   Clears up the polling interval. In case the polling wasn't already set up, the method will not do anything.
